availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Smith (Louisville, Kentucky, carpet merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, carpet merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Julia Mathers Smith in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on October 25, 1860. Father of Frank G. Smith and George Smith. Carpet merchant in partnership with James G. Mathers and Charles L. Taylor in J.G. Mathers & Company in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 534B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000819613.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), 433, 538.
"James Thomas Smith (1830-1875)," Find A Grave, Memorial 185647036, accessed December 8, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/185647036.
